commands.name: az network private-dns record-set ptr add-record
commands.syntax:
az network private-dns record-set ptr add-record --ptrdname
                                                 --record-set-name
                                                 --resource-group
                                                 --zone-name
examples:
az network private-dns record-set ptr add-record -g MyResourceGroup -z www.mysite.com \
    -n MyRecordSet -d another.site.com

commands.name: az network private-dns record-set ptr create
commands.summary: Create an empty PTR record set.
commands.syntax:
az network private-dns record-set ptr create --name
                                             --resource-group
                                             --zone-name
                                             [--metadata]
                                             [--ttl]
examples: az network private-dns record-set ptr create -g MyResourceGroup -z www.mysite.com -n MyRecordSet

commands.name: az network private-dns record-set ptr delete
commands.summary: Delete a PTR record set and all associated records.
commands.syntax:
az network private-dns record-set ptr delete [--ids]
                                             [--if-match]
                                             [--name]
                                             [--resource-group]
                                             [--subscription]
                                             [--yes]
                                             [--zone-name]
examples: az network private-dns record-set ptr delete -g MyResourceGroup -z www.mysite.com -n MyRecordSet

commands.name: az network private-dns record-set ptr list
commands.summary: List all PTR record sets in a zone.
commands.syntax:
az network private-dns record-set ptr list --resource-group
                                           --zone-name
                                           [--max-items]
                                           [--next-token]
examples: az network private-dns record-set ptr list -g MyResourceGroup -z www.mysite.com

commands.name: az network private-dns record-set ptr remove-record
commands.summary: Remove a PTR record from its record set.
commands.syntax:
az network private-dns record-set ptr remove-record --ptrdname
                                                    --record-set-name
                                                    --resource-group
                                                    --zone-name
                                                    [--keep-empty-record-set]
examples:
az network private-dns record-set ptr remove-record -g MyResourceGroup -z www.mysite.com \
    -n MyRecordSet -d another.site.com

commands.name: az network private-dns record-set ptr show
commands.summary: Get the details of a PTR record set.
commands.syntax:
az network private-dns record-set ptr show [--ids]
                                           [--name]
                                           [--resource-group]
                                           [--subscription]
                                           [--zone-name]
examples: az network private-dns record-set ptr show -g MyResourceGroup -z www.mysite.com -n MyRecordSet

commands.name: az network private-dns record-set ptr update
commands.syntax:
az network private-dns record-set ptr update [--add]
                                             [--force-string {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                                             [--ids]
                                             [--if-match]
                                             [--metadata]
                                             [--name]
                                             [--remove]
                                             [--resource-group]
                                             [--set]
                                             [--subscription]
                                             [--zone-name]
examples: az network private-dns record-set ptr update -g MyResourceGroup -z www.mysite.com -n MyRecordSet --metadata owner=WebTeam
